info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 18 at 1:04PM CDT until August 19 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Iowa...
Upper Iowa River at Decorah affecting Winneshiek County.
.The latest river forecast has increased the forecast crest from 10.5 to 12 feet which is now Minor flood stage.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Upper Iowa River at Decorah.
* WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Residential areas are threatened on the west edge of Decorah just before the levee protecting the town begins. Some agricultural flooding may also occur.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.9 feet on 06/10/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse.
The next statement will be issued late tonight by 115 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING
